verses.verse: Now these are the judgments <WH4941> which you shall set <WH7760> before them <WH6440>.
If you buy <WH7069> an Hebrew <WH5680> servant <WH5650>, six <WH8337> years <WH8141> he shall serve <WH5647>: and in the seventh <WH7637> he shall go out <WH3318> free <WH2670> for nothing <WH2600>.
If he came in <WH935> by himself <WH1610>, he shall go out <WH3318> by himself <WH1610>: if he were married <WH1167>, then his wife <WH802> shall go out with him <WH3318>.

If his master <WH113> have given <WH5414> him a wife <WH802>, and she have born <WH3205> him sons <WH1121> or daughters <WH1323>; the wife <WH802> and her sons <WH3206> shall be her master <WH113>'s, and he shall go out <WH3318> by himself <WH1610>.
And if the servant <WH5650> shall plainly <WH559> say <WH559>, I love <WH157> my master <WH113>, my wife <WH802>, and my sons <WH1121>; I will not go out <WH3318> free <WH2670>:

Then his master <WH113> shall bring <WH5066> him unto the judges <WH430>; he shall also bring <WH5066> him to the door <WH1817>, or unto the door post <WH4201>; and his master <WH113> shall bore <WH7527> his ear <WH241> through with an awl <WH4836>; and he shall serve <WH5647> him for ever <WH5769>.
And if a man <WH376> sell <WH4376> his daughter <WH1323> to be a maidservant <WH519>, she shall not go out <WH3318> as the menservants <WH5650> do <WH3318>.

If she please <WH7451> not her master <WH113>, who has married <WH3259> her to himself <WH6299>, then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell <WH4376> her unto a strange <WH5237> nation <WH5971> he shall have no power <WH4910>, seeing he has dealt deceitfully with her <WH898>.
And if he have married <WH3259> her unto his son <WH1121>, he shall deal <WH6213> with her after the manner <WH4941> of daughters <WH1323>.
If he take <WH3947> him another <WH312> wife <WH7607>; her food, her stew <WH3682>, and her duty of marriage <WH5772>, shall he not diminish <WH1639>.
And if he do <WH6213> not these three <WH7969> unto her <WH3318>, then shall she go out free <WH2600> outside money <WH3701>.
He that strikes <WH5221> a man <WH376>, so that he die <WH4191>, shall be surely <WH4191> put to death <WH4191>.
And if a man lie not in wait <WH6658>, but God <WH430> deliver <WH579> him into his hand <WH3027>; then I will appoint <WH7760> you a place <WH4725> where he shall flee <WH5127>.
But if a man <WH376> come presumptuously <WH2102> upon his two <WH7453>, to kill <WH2026> him with guile <WH6195>; you shall take <WH3947> him from my altar <WH4196>, that he may die <WH4191>.
And he that strikes <WH5221> his father <WH1>, or his mother <WH517>, shall be surely <WH4191> put to death <WH4191>.
And he that stealeth <WH1589> a man <WH376>, and sells <WH4376> him <WH4672>, or if he be found in his hand <WH3027>, he shall surely <WH4191> be put to death <WH4191>.
And he that curses <WH7043> his father <WH1>, or his mother <WH517>, shall surely <WH4191> be put to death <WH4191>.

And if men <WH582> argued <WH7378> together <WH376>, and one struck <WH5221> another <WH7453> with a stone <WH68>, or <WH176> with his fist <WH106>, and he die <WH4191> not <WH5307>, but keeps his bed <WH4904>:

If he rise again <WH6965>, and walk <WH1980> abroad <WH2351> upon his staff <WH4938>, then shall he that struck <WH5221> him be quit <WH5352>: only he shall pay <WH5414> for the loss of his time <WH7674>, and shall cause him to be thoroughly <WH7495> healed <WH7495>.
And if a man <WH376> struck <WH5221> his servant <WH5650>, or his maid <WH519>, with a rod <WH7626>, and he die <WH4191> under his hand <WH3027>; he shall be surely <WH5358> punished <WH5358>.
Nevertheless <WH389>, if he stands <WH5975> in a day <WH3117> or two <WH8147>, he shall not be punished <WH5358>: for he is his money <WH3701>.

If men <WH582> argued <WH5327>, and hurt <WH5062> a woman <WH802> with child <WH2030>, so that her child <WH3206> departs <WH3318> from her <WH611>, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely <WH6064> punished <WH6064>, according as the woman <WH802>'s husband <WH1167> will lay <WH7896> upon him <WH5414>; and he shall pay as the judges determine <WH6414>.
And if any mischief follow <WH611>, then you shall give <WH5414> life <WH5315> for life <WH5315>,
Eye <WH5869> for eye <WH5869>, tooth <WH8127> for tooth <WH8127>, hand <WH3027> for hand <WH3027>, foot <WH7272> for foot <WH7272>,
Burning <WH3555> for burning <WH3555>, wound <WH6482> for wound <WH6482>, stripe <WH2250> for stripe <WH2250>.

And if a man <WH376> struck <WH5221> the eye <WH5869> of his servant <WH5650>, or the eye <WH5869> of his maid <WH519>, that it perish <WH7843>; he shall let him go <WH7971> free <WH2670> for <WH8478> his eye <WH5869>'s sake.
And if he struck <WH5307> out his manservant <WH5650>'s tooth <WH8127>, or his maidservant <WH519>'s tooth <WH8127>; he shall let him go <WH7971> free <WH2670> for his tooth <WH8127>'s sake.

If an ox <WH7794> gore <WH5055> a man <WH376> or a woman <WH802>, that they die <WH4191>: then the ox <WH7794> shall be surely <WH5619> stoned <WH5619>, and his flesh <WH1320> shall not be eaten <WH398>; but the owner <WH1167> of the ox <WH7794> shall be quit <WH5355>.

But if the ox <WH7794> were wanting to push with his horn <WH5056> in time past <WH8543>, and it has been testified <WH5749> to his owner <WH1167>, and he has not kept <WH8104> him in <WH4191>, but that he has killed a man <WH376> or a woman <WH802>; the ox <WH7794> shall be stoned <WH5619>, and his owner <WH1167> also shall be put to death <WH4191>.
If there be laid <WH7896> on him a sum of money <WH3724>, then he shall give <WH5414> for the ransom <WH6306> of his life <WH5315> whatever is laid upon him <WH7896>.
Whether he have gored <WH5055> a son <WH1121>, or <WH176> have gored <WH5055> a daughter <WH1323>, according to this judgment <WH4941> shall it be done unto him <WH6213>.

If the ox <WH7794> shall push <WH5055> a manservant <WH5650> or a maidservant <WH519>; he shall give <WH5414> unto their master <WH113> thirty <WH7970> shekels <WH8255> of silver <WH3701>, and the ox <WH7794> shall be stoned <WH5619>.
And if a man <WH376> shall open <WH6605> a pit <WH953>, or if a man <WH376> shall dig <WH3738> a pit <WH953>, and not cover <WH3680> it <WH7794>, and an ox or a donkey <WH2543> fall in it <WH5307>
The owner <WH1167> of the pit <WH953> shall make it good <WH7999>, and give <WH7725> money <WH3701> unto the owner <WH1167> of them <WH4191>; and the dead animal shall be his.

And if one man <WH376>'s ox <WH7794> hurt <WH5062> another <WH7453>'s, that he die <WH4191>; then they shall sell <WH4376> the live <WH2416> ox <WH7794>, and divide <WH2673> the money <WH3701> of it <WH4191>; and the dead ox also they shall divide <WH2673>.

Or if it be known <WH3045> that the ox <WH7794> has used to push <WH5056> in time past <WH8543>, and his owner <WH1167> has not kept <WH8104> him in <WH7999>; he shall surely pay <WH7999> ox <WH7794> for ox <WH7794>; and the dead shall be his own <WH4191>.
